questions.question: Revocation of a driving privilege is the same as:
choices: A termination of a driver's license for an indefinite period of time
A withholding of a driver's license because the person is ineligible for a license
Declaring a driver's license void and terminated

questions.question: When brakes fail:
choices: Steer off the road
Apply your parking brake cautiously
Swing from one side of the road to the other to reduce speed

questions.question: A sign showing information about nearby motels is an example of a traffic sign with:
choices: White background
Blue background
Brown background

questions.question: If a traffic signal light is not working, you:
choices: May proceed without stopping if way is clear
Must always stop
May proceed without stopping if you reach the intersection first

questions.question: This sign means you:
choices: Have the right-of-way on a green light
May turn left on a green light when it is safe
Must yield to vehicles making a left turn

questions.question: Parking is not allowed:
choices: 20 feet from a fire hydrant
In front of a private driveway
On a hill

questions.question: What is the best advice to a driver who has taken too many drinks?
choices: To wait an hour before driving
To drink black coffee
To ask somebody who has not been drinking to drive

questions.question: If it starts to rain and you turn on your wipers, you should also:
choices: Slow down to 30 mph or less
Turn on your parking lights
Turn on your headlights

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Stop ahead
Divided highway
Traffic signal ahead

questions.question: When merging onto an expressway, you should be driving:
choices: At the legal expressway speed limit
At, or near the same speed as the expressway traffic
Faster than the expressway traffic

questions.question: You should stop before railroad tracks and not cross them if:
choices: The crossing is marked with a crossbuck sign
You cannot cross and clear the tracks
You cannot see the tracks for 500 feet in both directions

questions.question: If another driver follows you too closely (tailgated) on a two-way two-lane roadway, you should:
choices: Continue on the right shoulder to allow the tailgater to drive around you
Speed up to avoid getting hit from behind
Wait until the road ahead is clear, then reduce your speed slowly

questions.question: Which pavement marking separates traffic traveling in opposite directions?
choices: White solid lines
Yellow lines
Red lines

questions.question: If you have stopped at a red light at an intersection when an emergency vehicle with flashing lights approaches from behind, you should:
choices: Immediately drive through the intersection and stop
Turn to the left in the intersection and stop
Obey any instructions from firefighters or police officers

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Traffic must merge right
Two-way traffic
No passing

questions.question: When you drive through a construction zone, you should:
choices: Be prepared to slow down or stop
Slow down to watch the ongoing work
Decrease distance between you and any car ahead

questions.question: A loaded truck with air brakes traveling at 65 mph requires the following distance to come to a complete stop:
choices: More than 600 feet
130 feet

questions.question: An orange and red sign attached to the back of a vehicle means:
choices: The vehicle has the right-of-way
Slow-moving vehicle
Shoulder work ahead

questions.question: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb and turn the front wheels to the left:
choices: Back of the car will roll into the street if the brakes fail
Front of the car will roll into the street if the brakes fail
The curb will stop the car from rolling into the street

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:
choices: Low beam headlights
Parking lights
High beam headlights

questions.question: Which road signs have a three-sided pennant shape?
choices: Yield signs
Stop signs
Signs that mark no-passing zones

questions.question: You must pull over and stop for an emergency vehicle using a siren:
choices: When it approaches from any direction
Only when it approaches from behind, or from the other direction on a two-lane, two-way roadway
Only when it approaches from behind

questions.question: You may cross two solid yellow lines on a two-lane road:
choices: To pass a slow moving bicycle
To pass slower cars
Any time if it is safe to do so

questions.question: If an advisory speed sign isn't posted before a curve:
choices: You must judge how sharp the curve is and change your speed accordingly
It is always safe to keep the current speed
Slow down when you have entered the curve

questions.question: Which lane is closed for traffic going straight ahead?
choices: Lane A with a steady red X
Lane B with a steady green arrow
Lane C with a steady green arrow

questions.question: Rear-facing infant seats should:
choices: Be placed in the back seat
Only be placed in a front seat if an airbag is present
Be placed in a front seat

questions.question: Which of the following convictions will result in five points on your driving record?
choices: Failure to stop for stop sign
Failure to stop for school bus with flashing red lights
Careless driving

questions.question: To make a left turn you should:
choices: Signal at least 100 feet before the turn
While waiting to turn, keep your wheels pointed to the left
Turn as soon as possible and try to cut the corner

questions.question: Which is true about alcohol?
choices: Alcohol is the most important cause of death in car accidents
Alcohol reduces the depressant effects of other drugs
Alcohol can help drivers stay awake and alert for long periods

questions.question: One of the most frequent causes of collisions between motorcycles and other motor vehicles is:
choices: Motorcyclists failing to turn on headlights
Drivers sharing the lane with a motorcycle
Drivers turning in front of a motorcycle

questions.question: When driving past this sign:
choices: You are driving the wrong way on a one-way street
Turning left is not allowed
The road or street ahead is for one-way traffic. Do not enter in this direction

questions.question: When driving in a fog, you should:
choices: Reduce your speed
Follow other vehicles closely
Use your high beams

questions.question: Which light indicates that you may make a protected turn because oncoming traffic is stopped by a red light?
choices: A solid green light
A green arrow
A flashing yellow arrow

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Cross Road
Pedestrian crossing ahead
School or school crossing

questions.question: When approached from behind by an emergency vehicle with activated lights and sirens, you must:
choices: Steer to the extreme right of the roadway and proceed with caution
Steer to the extreme right of the roadway, stop and wait for the vehicle to pass
Maintain position, slow down and proceed with caution

questions.question: Road signs with a white background are usually:
choices: Stop signs
Guide signs
Regulatory signs

questions.question: Driving with a heavy load will:
choices: Make it more difficult to stop
Make it easier to overtake and pass other vehicles
Seriously affect battery life and cooling system

questions.question: If you see this sign ahead, it means:
choices: Divided highway ends
The road or street ahead is closed
Do not drive onto that street

questions.question: When driving on slick roads, you should:
choices: Change lanes quickly
Brake firm and hard
Turn slowly

questions.question: If you see an aggressive driver, it can be dangerous to:
choices: Pull off the road in a safe place
Speed up and try to out-maneuver him
Focus on your own driving

questions.question: When you have entered a roundabout, you must:
choices: Yield to entering traffic
Pass bicyclists or other vehicles on the outside
Turn on your turn signals when you want to exit

questions.question: When you proceed straight ahead on a solid green light, you must:
choices: Yield to any oncoming vehicle making a left turn
Yield to vehicles still in the intersection
Insist on the right-of-way

questions.question: This sign (red X) means:
choices: The road is closed ahead
You must stop ahead
You are not allowed to drive in the lane

questions.question: Which is true about drugs and driving?
choices: Drugs taken together with alcohol increases the risk of causing a crash
Some drugs make a driver more alert and are recommended when driving long distances
Drugs causes more highway accidents than alcohol

questions.question: When approaching a stopped school bus with flashing red lights traveling in the opposite direction on a four-lane roadway without median separation, you should:
choices: Always stop
Slow down and pass carefully
Stop only when the bus has stopped in a loading zone and pedestrians may cross the roadway

questions.question: Parking on a crosswalk in the middle of a block is:
choices: Allowed, if more than 20 feet from an intersection
Allowed, if there are no traffic lights
Never allowed

questions.question: When must you use your headlights?
choices: Before sunset
When you cannot see for a distance of 1,500 feet ahead
When driving through work zones

questions.question: When is it safe to pass a vehicle stopped at a crosswalk?
choices: Always
Never
In residential areas

questions.question: Always look carefully for motorcycles before you turn at an intersection because:
choices: They always have the right-of-way at intersections
They don't stop at intersections
The small size makes them more difficult to see
